Package gameLogic

Class Teams

  • java.lang.Object
    • gameLogic.Teams
  • public class Teams
extends java.lang.Object
    The list of all teams in this game, as well as infromation about their turn order.
    Author:
    Alexander

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      Teams()
      Initialized with no teams.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      void addTeam​(Team team)
      Adds a team to the roster, named by a String.
      void addTurnOrder​(Team team)
      Call this to add a turn in the rotation for an existing team.
      boolean currentTurnLocal()
      Determines if the current team's control is the user or something else.
      Team[] getTeams()
      Gives a list of all the team names, in no particular order.
      Team getTurn()
      Gets the name of the team whose turn it is.
      void incrementTurn()
      Advances to the next turn on the turn order list.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • Teams

        public Teams()
        Initialized with no teams.

    • Method Detail

      • addTeam

        public void addTeam​(Team team)
        Adds a team to the roster, named by a String. Does not add to turn rotation.
        Parameters:
        name - The name of the team.

      • getTeams

        public Team[] getTeams()
        Gives a list of all the team names, in no particular order.
        Returns:
        The list of teams.

      • addTurnOrder

        public void addTurnOrder​(Team team)
        Call this to add a turn in the rotation for an existing team.
        Parameters:
        team -

      • getTurn

        public Team getTurn()
        Gets the name of the team whose turn it is.
        Returns:
        The name of the team which has the current turn.

      • incrementTurn

        public void incrementTurn()
        Advances to the next turn on the turn order list.

      • currentTurnLocal

        public boolean currentTurnLocal()
        Determines if the current team's control is the user or something else.
        Returns:
        true if it's the current user, false if it's a CPU or non-local player.
